lines.gurmukhi: jYsy qau Arog Bog BogvY nwnw pRkwr biRQwvMq Kwin pwn irdY n ihqwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Tau Arog Bhog Bhogavai Naanaa Prakaara , Bridaavant Khaani Paan Ridai N Hitaavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a healthy person eats many types of dishes and eatables but a sick man does not like eating any of them.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy mhKI shnsIl kY DIrju Dujw AijAw mY qnk klyjo n smwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Mahakhee Sahanaseel Kai Dheeraju Dhujaa , Ajiaa Mai Tanak Kalayjo N Samaavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a buffalo, because of its tolerance is known to have great patience but a goat on the other hand does not have even a fraction of that patience.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy jauhrI ibswhY vycy hIrw mwnkwid rMk pY n rwiKE prY jog n jugwveI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Jauharee Bisaahai Vaychay Heeraa Maanakaadi , Rank Pai N Raakhiao Parai Jog N Jougaavaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a jeweller trades in diamonds and precious stones but no valuable diamond can be kept with a pauper since he does not have the ability to keep such expensive item.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy gur prcY pivqR hY pUjw pRswid prc Aprcy dusih duK pwveI ]505]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Gur Parachai Pavitr Hai Poojaa Prasaadi , Parach Aparachay Dousahi Doukh Paavaee ?505?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, a devotee who remains engaged in the service and remembrance of the Lord, eating the offerings and consecrated food for him is justified. But he who is far removed from obeying the command of the Guru cannot consume the worship offerings. Consu
